body:
Whenever I try to connect to the AV teamspeak I get " Failed to resolve hostname 'ts.avicore.net' "
I've tried flushing my dns, but no luck so far.
Any help would be great :)

replies.body: ts.avicus.net should work. If it doesn't work the first time, click "Connect" again. That usually works for me. If that doesn't work, please take a picture of the error message you are receiving and put it here.
replies.body_tagged: ts.avicus.net should work. If it doesn't work the first time, click "Connect" again. That usually works for me. If that doesn't work, please take a picture of the error message you are receiving and put it here.

replies.body: http://gyazo.com/2e42b27a3e4bb48c3530ff3df8df2e80
replies.body_tagged: http://gyazo.com/2e42b27a3e4bb48c3530ff3df8df2e80

replies.body: Try connecting twice in a row, in rapid succession. As soon as it says "cannot resolve hostname," try again. That often happens to me, and trying to connect a second time resolves the issue.
replies.body_tagged: Try connecting twice in a row, in rapid succession. As soon as it says "cannot resolve hostname," try again. That often happens to me, and trying to connect a second time resolves the issue.

replies.body: Still not working
replies.body_tagged: Still not working

replies.body: Then your computer is likely blocking the port that TS is using. Fraid I won't be able to help you with that. Sorry. Others might be able to though.
replies.body_tagged: Then your computer is likely blocking the port that TS is using. Fraid I won't be able to help you with that. Sorry. Others might be able to though.

replies.body: This was a problem for Yoav and Cole as well, they fixed it by continuously uninstalling and reistalling TeamSpeak :P
